    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        public static void addEvent(Event newEvent)
        Adds an event object into the eventList for future reference. *The events are inserted in order, but this does not matter with current implementation.
        Parameters:
        newEvent - the Event object to be inserted

      • removeEvent

        public static void removeEvent(Event delEvent)
        Removes an event object from the eventList.
        Parameters:
        delEvent - the Event object to be removed from the list

      • removeAllInstancesOfEvent

        public static void removeAllInstancesOfEvent(Event delEvent)
        UNUSED METHOD - Delete all instances of a repeating event.
        Parameters:
        delEvent - event to use in deletion of all corresponding weekly events

      • addCategory

        public static void addCategory(Category newCategory)
        Adds an Category object into the categoryList for future reference.
        Parameters:
        newCategory - the Category object to be inserted

      • removeCategory

        public static void removeCategory(Category category)
        Removes a Category object from the categoryList.
        Parameters:
        category - the Category object to be removed from the list

      • getEvents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Event> getEvents()
        Fetches the ArrayList containing all stored Event objects.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Events containing all events

      • getEvents

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Event> getEvents(java.util.Date startPeriod,
                                                   java.util.Date endPeriod)
        Fetches the ArrayList containing all stored Event objects that occur with the time period between the two params.
        Parameters:
        startPeriod - Date object representing the beginning of the period to look in
        endPeriod - Date object representing the ending of the period to look in
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Events containing all stored events that occur between startPeriod and endPeriod

      • getCategories

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Category> getCategories()
        Fetches the CategoryList containing all stored Category objects.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Category objects containing all stored categories
